result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Dajohn D Norwood

records.addlTxt: Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 7, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Dajohn D Norwood in court.  Attorney John j Forrestal in court for Dajohn D Norwood.  Attorney Michael Jerome Lonski in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Defendant advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties; waives constitutional rights, enters a plea of  GUILTY  and is examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the Complaint as a factual basis for judgment.  Court finds defendant guilty as charged in the Information/Complaint and orders a judgment of conviction be entered.

COURT ADVISES the defendant he cannot possess firearms; further, defendant is advised he cannot vote until his civil rights are restored.  Defendant was further advised that if not a United States citizen deportation is possible. 

PSI not ordered.  Court orders case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 28.  State is not requesting remand.  Bail conditions to remain as previously set.
State advises Court he has video for Court to review prior to sentencing.

Clerk:  jms
JusticePoint Supervision Report dated September 15, 2022 - received
Plea date scheduled for September 16, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Dajohn D Norwood in court with Attorney John Forrestal.  Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  All parties appear in person.
Defense counsel requests adjournment for plea hearing.
Court orders case adjourned for plea hearing in Branch 28.

Clerk:  jms
JusticePoint Supervision Report dated July 14, 2022 - received

Defendant Dajohn D Norwood in court with attorney John j Forrestal.  Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Forrestal is requesting an additional scheduling date as he recently received discovery.  Court grants request.  MN  All parties are notified that effective June 13, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge Mark Sanders, Branch 28, in Room 620 of the Safety Building.  Status conference scheduled for July 15, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Dajohn D Norwood in court with Attorney John j Forrestal.  Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for scheduling conference.  The scheduling conference was held in person.    Defense is requesting a status conference.  The matter is adjourned back to Branch 25. 
  Status conference scheduled for June 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Dajohn D Norwood in court with Attorney Fred Richardson; both appear by video.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 25, Judge Rothstein. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 25.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 3, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Adjustment Number: 22A 029499,
Payable Number: 995404,
Receipt Number: 22RP012339,
Amount: $20.00

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  
No driving without a valid license.
Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Dajohn D Norwood in court with attorney Jeff Allen Schwarz.  Defendant Dajohn D Norwood in custody.  Erika Strebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Dajohn D Norwood appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Rothstein, Branch 25.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  

This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:
